<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 278, 232, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 907, 294]]<|/det|>
9709/32  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 303, 907, 319]]<|/det|>
May/June 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 771, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\ln (2x^{2} - 3) = 2\ln x - \ln 2\), giving your answer in an exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
On an Argand diagram, sketch the locus of points representing complex numbers \(z\) satisfying \(|z + 3 - 2\mathrm{i}| = 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 504, 148, 522]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 504, 850, 522]]<|/det|>
Find the least value of \(|z|\) for points on this locus, giving your answer in an exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 504, 920, 522]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Use this iterative formula to calculate \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 494, 92]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(3x^{2} + 4xy + 3y^{2} = 5.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 108, 146, 127]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 103, 371, 128]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = -\frac{3x + 2y}{2x + 3y}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 109, 920, 128]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact coordinates of the two points on the curve at which the tangent is parallel to \(y + 2x = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 583, 92]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 100, 561, 133]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{4 + 9y^2}{\mathrm{e}^{2x + 1}}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 140, 420, 160]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = 0\) when \(x = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 172, 751, 191]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation, obtaining an expression for \(y\) in terms of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 173, 920, 191]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 87, 688, 268]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 285, 720, 306]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = (x + 5)\sqrt{3 - 2x}\) and its maximum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 317, 146, 336]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 317, 420, 336]]<|/det|>
Find the exact coordinates of \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 317, 920, 336]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Using the substitution \(u = 3 - 2x\), find by integration the area of the shaded region bounded by the curve and the \(x\)-axis. Give your answer in the form \(a\sqrt{13}\), where \(a\) is a rational number. [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The points \(A\) and \(B\) have position vectors \(\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} - 2\mathbf{k}\) and \(2\mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k}\) respectively. The line \(l\) has equation \(\mathbf{r} = \mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} + 3\mathbf{k} + \mu (2\mathbf{i} - 3\mathbf{j} + 4\mathbf{k})\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 119, 665, 138]]<|/det|>
Show that \(l\) does not intersect the line passing through \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 698, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the position vector of the foot of the perpendicular from \(A\) to \(l\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 74, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
